snippet: Mitt Romney’s claim that he can lower tax rates by 20 percent and pay for it by ending deductions has run into a wall.
abstract: Editorial notes that a new analysis by the bipartisan Joint Committee on Taxation has found that Mitt Romney's proposed tax plan could not possibly reduce tax rates by 20 percent merely by ending loopholes and deductions; holds that the proposal is simply another rhapsody based on old Republican themes that something can be had for nothing.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s claim that he can lower tax rates by 20 percent and pay for it by ending deductions has run into a wall.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney Needs a Working Calculator
headline.main: Mr. Romney Needs a Working Calculator
headline.print_headline: Mr. Romney Needs a Working Calculator
